DOC.detailed_description: The objective study determine whether use atypical antipsychotic associate increase risk hospitalization hyperglycemic emergency ( hyperglycemia , diabetic ketoacidosis , hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state ) . A common-protocol approach use conduct retrospective cohort study use administrative health care data eight jurisdiction ( Canadian province British Columbia , Alberta , Saskatchewan , Manitoba , Ontario , Quebec , Nova Scotia , well United Kingdom ( UK ) General Practice Research Database [ GPRD ] ) . Briefly , Canadian database include population-level data physician billing , diagnose procedure hospital discharge abstract , dispensation prescription drug . The data Nova Scotia , Ontario , Alberta restrict patient age 65 year old , prescription data available young patient . The GPRD clinical database representative UK population contains record patient see 680 general practitioner practice UK . The date study cohort entry define date prescription ( GPRD ) dispensation ( site ) newly-prescribed antipsychotic . Patients study cohort follow date study cohort entry event ( define ) , censor due death departure database , 365 day cohort entry , end study period ( March 31 , 2011 ) , whichever occur first .
